v.v: “Comfort, comfort my people,” says your God.
“Speak tenderly to Jerusalem; and proclaim to her
A voice cries out,
Every valley will be lifted up, and every mountain and hill will be leveled;
and the glory of Yahweh will be revealed, and all people will see it together; for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken it.
A voice says, “Cry.” Another answers, “What should I cry?”
The grass withers and the flower wilts when the breath of Yahweh blows on it; surely humanity is grass.
The grass withers, the flower wilts, but the word of our God will stand forever.”
Go up on a high mountain, Zion, bearer of good news.
Look, the Lord Yahweh comes as a victorious warrior, and his strong arm rules for him.
He will feed his flock like a shepherd, he will gather in his arm the lambs,
Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, measured the sky with the span of his hand,
Who has comprehended the mind of Yahweh, or instructed him as his counselor?
From whom did he ever receive instruction? Who taught him the correct way to do things,
Look, the nations are like a drop in a bucket, and are regarded like the dust on the scales;
Lebanon is not sufficient fuel,
All the nations are insufficient before him; they are regarded by him as nothing.
To whom then will you compare God? To what idol will you liken him?
An idol! A craftsman casts it: The goldsmith overlays it with gold
To make an offering one chooses a wood that will not rot;
Have you not known? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning?
He is the one who sits above the horizon of the earth; and the inhabitants are like grasshoppers before him.
He reduces rulers to nothing and makes the rulers of the earth insignificant.
They are barely planted, barely sown, their stem has barely taken root in the earth,
“To whom then will you compare me, whom do I resemble?”
Look up at the sky! Who has created all these stars?
Why do you say, Jacob, and declare, Israel,
Have you not known? Have you not heard?
He gives strength to the tired; and to the weak he gives renewed energy.
Even young people become tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall:
but those who wait for Yahweh will renew their strength; they will soar with wings like eagles;

v: that her warfare has ended, that her iniquity is pardoned,
that she has received double from Yahweh’s hand for all her sins.”
“In the wilderness prepare the way of Yahweh;
make straight in the Arabah a highway for our God.”
and the rugged land will be made level, and the rough places a plain;
“All flesh is grass, and all their covenant faithfulness is like the flower of the field.
Shout out loud, Jerusalem. You who bring good news, raise your voice, do not be afraid.
Say to the cities of Judah, “Here is your God!”
See, his reward is with him, and those he has rescued go before him.
and carry them close to his heart,
and will gently lead the ewes nursing their young.
held the dust of the earth in a basket, weighed the mountains in scales,
or the hills in a balance?
and taught him knowledge, or showed to him the way of understanding?
see, he weighs the isles as a speck.
nor its wild animals sufficient for a burnt offering.
and forges silver chains for it.
he seeks a skillful artisan to make an idol that will not fall over.
Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth?
He stretches out the heavens like a curtain and spreads them out as a tent to live in.
when he blows upon them and they wither, and the wind carries them away like straw.
He leads out their formations and calls them all by name.
By the greatness of his might and by the strength of his power, not one is missing.
“My way is hidden from Yahweh, and my God is not concerned about my vindication”?
The everlasting God, Yahweh, the Creator of the ends of the earth,
does not get tired or weary; there is no limit to his understanding.
they will run and not be weary; they will walk and not faint.
